---
title: "Running"
output: rmarkdown::html_document
---

In the commands below, `LOCAL_CACHE_DIR` is simply a placeholder for an actual directory
at your local computer/client.

1. Get BRAF-targeted drugs, list records per indication

	`drugs <- pharmaOncoX::get_onco_drugs(cache_dir = LOCAL_CACHE_DIR, drug_is_targeted = T,
	drug_target = c('BRAF'))`

2. Get _approved_ BRAF-targeted drugs, list records per indication

	`drugs <- pharmaOncoX::get_onco_drugs(cache_dir = LOCAL_CACHE_DIR, drug_is_targeted = T,
	drug_target = c('BRAF'), drug_is_approved = T)`


3. Get BRAF-targeted drugs, Open Targets Platform only, list per drug only

	`drugs <- pharmaOncoX::get_onco_drugs(cache_dir = LOCAL_CACHE_DIR, drug_is_targeted = T,
	drug_target = c('BRAF'), source_opentargets_only = T, output_resolution = "drug" )`
	

4. Get immune checkpoint inhibitors, list per drug-target entry

   `drugs <- pharmaOncoX::get_onco_drugs(cache_dir = LOCAL_CACHE_DIR, is_immune_checkpoint_inhibitor = T,
   output_resolution = "drug2target")`
   
5. Get immune checkpoint inhibitors indicated for tumor subtypes within "Colon/Rectum", list per drug-target entry

   `drugs <- pharmaOncoX::get_onco_drugs(cache_dir = LOCAL_CACHE_DIR, is_immune_checkpoint_inhibitor = T,
   output_resolution = "drug2target", drug_indication_main = "Colon/Rectum")`
   
6. Get antimetabolites

   `drugs <- pharmaOncoX::get_onco_drugs(cache_dir = LOCAL_CACHE_DIR, is_antimetabolite = T,
   output_resolution = "drug")`
